data.title: Behindwoods : Sonia Agarwal Interview
data.text:
Question: Some of the journalists have seen you traveling with Selvaraghavan in a car around the city. But you refuse to accept that you are in love with him?

Sonia Agarwal: If I travel with a person in a car, does it mean that I am in love with him? Yes, I love him. I see him as my teacher, philosopher and guide and not as you all think. I want to tell you one thing frankly, if I am in love with Selvaragavan and going to marry him, neither my parents nor his family would object it. Then why should I hide these facts from you?

Question: Then why do lot of magazines and various newspapers gossip about you?

Sonia Agarwal: Whoever meets me in person, they talk with me well, but write all nonsense which I can't tolerate. Through this interview I request all of you to criticize me to the core about my acting in films, but please donâ€™t spoil my privacy.

Question: Sometimes you appear as if you have some personal worries?

Sonia Agarwal: I don't want to say or talk anything personal. My aim in life is to entrench myself in the Tamil cine field as a heroine.

Question: Are you acting in other language films?

Sonia Agarwal: It all depends on the reputation that a film producing company has in the field. Tamil, Telugu and Malayalam are the same to me. I was cheated twice by film companies. They settled my account with a meager advance. Some production companies did not pay the money for hotel where I stayed then.

Question: Who is your role model?

Sonia Agarwal: My role model is Madhuri Dixit. In tamil I like Jothika, Meena and Simran.

Question: Who are your favorite heroes?

Sonia Agarwal: I am a fan of Vijay. Other heroes whom I like are Simbhu and Srikanth.
